name: A Lot of Nothing Quiz | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: What candy bar was named after a horse?
questions.explanation:
Snickers.

	It was the name of a horse belonging to the family of candy manufacturer Forrest Mars.

questions.text: Who was the last active player in major league baseball to have been in the Negro Leagues?
questions.explanation:
Hank Aaron.

	The Milwaukee Braves organization bought him for {$7,500} from the Indianapolis Clownes in 1952.

questions.text: What unique physical feature led officials to name two primates at the Philedelphia Zoo Redford and Bardot?
questions.explanation:
Blue eyes.

	The pair are blue-eyed lemurs. They are the only primates other than humans with true blue eyes. All animals of the species in U.S. zoos are named after blue-eyed movie stars.

questions.text: An American hockey team won the Stanley Cup for the first time in what year?
questions.explanation:
1917.

	It was won by the Seattle Metropolitans.

questions.text: Who was pictured on the Great Seal of the Confederacy?
questions.explanation:
Washington.

	He was a southerner and a slave owner.

questions.text: In show business slang, what are hum-heads?
Where were the tuner and the volume controls located on the first car radio when it was introduced in 1929?
questions.explanation:
Steering wheel.

	The radio, a black box containing vacuum tubes and a speaker was mounted under the dashboard and two batteries that powered it were under the seat.

questions.text: For whom did Michael Jackson remove his sunglasses during the Grammy Award ceremony in 1983?
questions.explanation:
Katharine Hepburn.

	Jackson who had been admonished by Hepburn for wearing shades at the American Music Awards, announced, 'Katherine, this is for you,' as he accepted one of the eight Grammys he received during the ceremony.

questions.text: What company supplied the glass for Thomas Edison's first lightbulb?
questions.explanation:
Corning Inc.

	In 1880 it was known as the Corning Glass Works.

questions.text: Who gave jazz great Wynton Marsalis his first trumpet?
questions.explanation:
Al Hirt.

	Al Hirt was also a fellow New Orleans native. He gave it to Wynton when he was just 6 years old.
